entities.name: bell jar
entities.description: The bell jar is described as a container that holds the man's head and glittering wind. It is also mentioned that his head sank through the surface of the bell jar.

entities.name: soap bubble
entities.description: The bell jar is compared to a soap bubble, indicating its fragile and ephemeral nature.

entities.name: glittering wind
entities.description: The glittering wind is described as being inside the bell jar, but it is not clear what it is or where it comes from.

entities.name: Harry's wand
entities.description: Harry's wand is mentioned as flying into Hermione's hand and then being thrown to Harry.

entities.name: Hermione
entities.description: Hermione is described as throwing Harry's wand to him after it flew into her hand.

entities.name: Neville
entities.description: Neville is mentioned as being horrified and staring at the Death Eater's head in the bell jar.

entities.name: Death Eater
entities.description: The Death Eater's head is described as shrinking and changing into a baby's head.

relationships.description: The bell jar contains the man's head, which sinks through its surface.
Harry owns a wand that flies into Hermione's hand and then is thrown to him.
Hermione temporarily possesses Harry's wand after it flew into her hand.
Neville observes the Death Eater's head in the bell jar and is horrified.
